body.name: SmallRig Upgraded 62.2" Carbon Fiber Tripod Monopod with Center Column, Compact Lightweight Tripod with 360° Ball Head, Quick Release Plate, for DSLR Camera, Video Camcorder, Load up to 26.5 lbs/12 kg
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 5 hrs 54 mins
features: 【Enhanced Shooting Flexibility】 The SmallRig carbon fiber tripod is engineered for multi-scene/angle shooting. Featuring a easily reversible and detachable center column, this travel tripod enables you to effortlessly capture stunning low-angle shots.The camera tripod provides three adjustable angles with quick-adjustment buckles, allowing you to easily find the optimal position for your shots. It allows you to shoot in narrow areas or on uneven terrain for different shooting scenarios.

【Premium Carbon Fiber Construction】 Crafted from high-end carbon fiber material, this tripod leg not only ensures lightweight and strength but also boasts excellent texture. It offers enhanced corrosion and abrasion resistance, ensuring its durability over time. Despite weighing a mere 2.6 lbs, it can securely hold equipment weighing up to 26.4 lbs. Moreover, the lightweight tripod includes a handbag, allowing for easy transportation to specialized and complex environments.

【2-IN-1 Tripod & Monopod】 The tripod can be easily turned into a monopod or walking stick, it is a good companion for you to go hiking or traveling. 4-section column legs with 3 quick release flip-locks allows you to adjust the working height from 17.3" to 62.2" in seconds. It is more flexible and easy to use than the knob lock. 15.8" folden size is easily took to anywhere for outdoor photography.

【360° Detachable Ball-Head】 With the quick-release panoramic ball head, you can effortlessly capture photos from any angle. The ball head swivels 360° and tilts 90° through the damping adjustment knob, providing extensive shooting possibilities. The gimbal also features a 360° horizontal scale, enhancing positioning accuracy. Moreover, the high-compatibility quick release system is compatible for Arca-Swiss QR plates.

【Innovative Design】 Setting itself apart from other tripods, this product incorporates a 1/4" threaded hole in the bracket. This additional feature supports the use of external magic arms, mobile phones, monitors, and more. Package Include : SmallRig Carbon Fiber Tripod x 1, storage package x 1, user manual x 1.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Excellent quality, very sturdy and lightweight. It stays very steady with my Canon EOS R6 with the big and heavy 24-70-f2.8.The only CON is that the lock system for the plate forces you to use a screwdriver or coin or something, it does not come with a little peace to turn the lock.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is not a bad tripod, but it is on a bulky side. I actually ended up buying a different brand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great tripod for a good price
reviews.reviewText: Like most SmallRig stuff I get, this tripod is a good addition to your kit. Tall and sturdy and not very heavy. I recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars SmallRig for the WIN
reviews.reviewText: I am a huge fan of SmallRig gear... I know it is consistently good quality and everything is interchangeable. I have mostly been using stuff for mobile photography and this is the first thing I have picked up for my full size camera. This is an extremely nice tripod and very sturdy. The carbon fiber makes it so much lighter than my already light aluminum tripods. Its built very well and works great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great lightweight option
reviews.reviewText: This tripod is a great option if you're looking for something versatile and lightweight. This is an excellent product for traveling, outdoors usage, or to keep in your car for spontaneous shoots. I'm 5'10 and the fully extended height on this tripod is a little bit short for me if I intend to look through the viewfinder but works out great if I'm shooting tethered or using the rotating LCD screen on my camera to compose. Obviously I can also just bend down a bit but if it's a longer shoot, I don't prefer that as it's taxing on my spine. As I said though, it's a great option for on the go as it's super lightweight. This thing feels about half the weight of a similarly sized non-carbon fiber tripod I often carry. I love that the center column can be reversed for low angle shooting and one of the legs can be removed to be used as a monopod. The versatility of this design alone is well worth the money. The folded size of this tripod makes it a great addition to a backpack or tucked into a rolling case but I prefer to keep mine under the seat in my car so that I have it when I need it. It's not going to replace the heavy duty, tall and rock solid monsters I like to use in my studio but I think this SmallRig tripod is destined to be my go-to when I'm on the go.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is my second SmallRig tripod, they are that good!
reviews.reviewText: This is my second SmallRig tripod because their carbon fiber smaller travel tripods are excellent, no-fail pieces of kit. This tripod is no exception as it is a well-thought out set-up for still photographers. The ballhead, while small, is perfectly matched for lighter setups. I use this one when I have about a 6-7 pound camera and lens and can't be using the car to carry my heavy Gitzo. This is one is great for hiking out to a site and then setting it up. The legs locks are ver secure although I prefer twist to lever locks. Nonetheless they do not slip or slide. It folds up nicely so that it can be carried strapped to a camera backpack or messenger bag. The QR system is ARCA-Swiss compatible so I can use all my cages for SMallRig and other companies, no need going to a Manfrotto system. The ball head doesn't seize on lockdown and I can crank it to be super solid. I have great faith in it as well, using it to carry my rig and throwing the tripod over my shoulder as I walk to a new location. SmallRig makes great, well-engineered stuff. In a choice between SmallRig and other video gear companies, I always go SmallRig.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I think that the most interesting thing about this tripod is that they went with the detachable monopod, but also decided to use lever latches for the leg extensions. I almost always see twist locks for this mechanism just because you don't have to worry about the levers lining up on the outside after you spin the monopod leg on. I still don't know how it works so well, but the leg always stops right with the locks lined up facing outward. It's a great design.The levers are also don't stick out very far, so I don't have to worry about my cords getting snagged on them. The legs slide up and down about as well as I've come to expect out of carbon fiber. It's not as smooth as aluminum, but it's much lighter, and very strong.The weight hook is spring loaded, so it can be pulled out to hold a sandbag, or left up to also reduce the possibility of snagging wires. I also find this to be handy to use as a way of clamping wires if I want to hold them in place.The whole thing is very light, and even the bag has fairly thick cord so it doesn't bite into your hand if you want to carry it around for a long period of time.The feet are removable in the event I want to swap them with metal spikes, and the ball head has full articulation with a slight drag to help get smooth feeling moving shots.Overall a great tripod.Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This tripod is a lightweight very sturdy easy to use
